results.title: Pitch Black Heist
results.creator_credit: John Maclean, Gerardine O'Flynn, Film4, UK Film Council and DMC Film
results.brief_description: Liam (Liam Cunningham) and Michael (Michael Fassbender) are professional safe crackers who meet on a simple job to relieve an office safe from its contents. The catch is a light-activated alarm system.

results.title: Only Sound Remains
results.creator_credit: Aliocha Allard, Pierre-Alain Giraud, Arash Ashtiani, Anshu Poddar and London Film School
results.brief_description: In the wake of the violent post-election protests in Iran, a man and his wife, Babak and Nahid, try to hide the devastating news from Babak’s grandmother that his brother is missing.

results.title: Mwansa the Great
results.creator_credit: Rungano Nyoni, Gabriel Gauchet, ICreateFilms and UK Film Council
results.brief_description: A little boy sees himself as ‘Mwansa the great’, a full-grown warrior hunting lions. His little sister also visualises herself as an adult, ‘Princess Shula’ who is responsible for disciplining and looking after Mwansa.

results.title: The Race
results.creator_credit: Nikki Rose, Kinetoscope Productions and First Light
results.brief_description: Neil and David met at nursery school. There was something different about Neil but David liked him, even though he often got himself into a bad temper. Neil knew that because of his condition eventually they would part company but David vowed that they would always remain best friends.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nikki Rose, Kinetoscope Productions and First Light

results.title: One Man's Walk
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Mitchell, Interplay Theatre and First Light
results.brief_description: A boy walks down a street. We do not see his face. He is the event but we don’t know why. He tells us his likes and dislikes as he passes through the streets of his town. Finally we see his face and understand.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kenneth Mitchell, Interplay Theatre and First Light

results.title: A Mile in our Shoes
results.creator_credit: Sarah Mortimer, Daniel Walker, Karl Armstrong, Steph Winward, The Junction, Middlesbrough Football Club Study Support, Riverside Studios and First Light
results.brief_description: The average age of a young carer in the UK is 12. This is a poignant and moving tribute to those many young carers tending to parents or siblings or both. They manage the domestic needs of a household as well as the physical needs of those they are caring for. They sometimes care for more than one family member with ailments ranging from autism to muscular dystrophy. With a constant lack of understanding from the rest of the world, no wonder there is little time for sleep let alone a social life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Mortimer, Daniel Walker, Karl Armstrong, Steph Winward, The Junction, Middlesbrough Football Club Study Support, Riverside Studios and First Light

results.title: Destination Point
results.creator_credit: Bloom Productions, Argyle Primary School and First Light
results.brief_description: Year 5 Primary school pupils from Kings Cross explore the ethnic diversity of their area and school. Kings Cross is an international destination point. Thousands of people travel in and out of the station every day. Some are travelling through on their way to somewhere else, some come into work and others travel to Kings Cross and make it home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bloom Productions, Argyle Primary School and First Light

results.title: Until My Heart's, Like, Finished
results.creator_credit: Phil Shepherd, Martin Hodgson, Peter Snelling, Somerset Film and First Light
results.brief_description: On the day of your 16th birthday, your mum kicks you out of home for good. You live in a car. You sofa surf. You sleep rough. Life for these young people has been tough with many challenges. Here they tell their stories in their own words, reveal they have learnt about how to survive and make plans for putting their lives back together.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phil Shepherd, Martin Hodgson, Peter Snelling, Somerset Film and First Light

Here they tell their stories in their own words, reveal they have learnt about how to survive and make plans for putting their lives back together.

results.title: Prehistoric Pet Shop
results.creator_credit: George Ing, Chris Barnard, Mathew Buck, Create Studios, Dacoit Studios, Evil Twin Artworks and First Light
results.brief_description: Prehistoric Pet Shop is about a caveman whose alarm clock stops working. But not just any alarm clock - the clock was a bird with an unfortunate heart problem. The caveman goes to the pet shop to complain about his faulty alarm clock. A homage to Monty Python’s parrot sketch, this hilarious short reveals that complaining can get you more than just a new alarm clock.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Ing, Chris Barnard, Mathew Buck, Create Studios, Dacoit Studios, Evil Twin Artworks and First Light
